body: can't hurt also circleCI has ssh access and keeps the artifacts for download --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/369)

comment_regular_data.body: @zoff99 good morning, while I take a look at this can you squash all these commits down into a single commit and give it a descriptive commit message?
i mostly use the webinterface. it would be easier if you quash them on merge. there is a button for that here in the webgui.

I'm happy to do that for you, but that's not an option on this repo, because it'll change the sha of the commit. There's a button to the right that enables contributors to push to your branch. If you check the box, I'll squash them for you.
yaaaarp. done
done, and done

>     - cd ~/libsodium/ ; cd libsodium/ ; sudo ldconfig
> ```

Why do you navigate into the same directory every single command, instead of just doing it once?

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 4 unresolved discussions. --- *[circle.yml, line 25 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/369#-K_LgihGWn2r3rLc-cvL:-K_P55BGQiAeeya-V9-x:b-964ejg) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/aacefb5418da7172949f2ae2575226a240dc582a/circle.yml#L25)):*
Previously, zoff99 (Zoff) wrote…
so i can switch easily (for testing or otherwise) to a different commit of libsodium. lets say a new version is out and or want to test with a PR but if you want this changed you can do it. it won't be usable for me then
If there is a use case, we can consider supporting it, but I can't see one. When do you actually want to do this? Why is it different for libsodium and libc? I consider the crypto functions to be a given and the API to be roughly as stable as the C standard library. For pull request testing, I don't think adding a few minutes of build time and a bunch of build script complexity (ynaan, ldconfig) that we need to maintain is worth it. If you want to test with a PR, you can spend your 1 minute of adding back these lines to the script and pushing it instead of everybody spending 1.5 minutes (20% of the total build time) on every push waiting for libsodium to build and run its internal test suite. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/369)*

Previously, zoff99 (Zoff) wrote…
sure. make a suggestion? i am not sure what else to write
"Test command" is less useful than "so that test xxx works". Reading "Test command", I have no idea what this line is about. Just replacing "test 7" with "network_test" would have been very useful. I'm ok with "so that network_test works". --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/369)*
